Title: Work on (something) / Work for (someone) / work to (purpose)
Happy with (something)/ happy for (someone)/ Happy to (purpose) / Satisfied with
Arrive in (a city/country) / Arrive at (a building/event)
Apply for (a job) / Apply to (a company/university)
Pay for / by (means of transaction) (cheque card (in cash)) (methods of payment)
Agree with (a person) / Agree on (a topic/plan)
Think about (consider) / Think of (recall or have an idea)
Take a break / Take a look / Take a picture / Take notes
Make a decision / Make a mistake / Make a call / Make progress
Do your best / Do business / Do research / Do the dishes
Have a meeting / Have a question / Have an idea / Have a feeling
Give advice / Give a presentation / Give it a try / Give someone a hand (help)
Set a goal / Set a deadline / Set an alarm
Meet a deadline / Meet a goal / Meet the requirements (cumplir)
Run a company / Run a meeting / Run (bump) into someone (meet unexpectedly)
Example: We are running into problems in the current project ## We might run into some issues if you pressure us into delivering before doing all the necessary due diligence and testing.

Title: Actually... (Often used to gently correct or add nuance)
Basically... / Essentially... (To summarize the core idea)
Sort of / Kind of (To soften a statement: "It's kind of difficult.") /Sorav/ (more or less / a type of sth)
Example: Is The task difficult? Sort of

Title: As a matter of fact... / In fact... (A more natural alternative)
On the other hand... (To introduce a contrasting point)
By the way... (To introduce a new related topic) BTW
At the end of the day... (Ultimately or when everything is considered)
Example: Al final de todo lo que importa es la familia ### In conclusion

Title: Aware of → Tener consciencia o conocimiento de esto
Example: Where you aware of this ?## Sorry I wasn’t aware I had to do this ## Yes boss I’m well aware of what this task requires.

Title: Capable of → I’m capable of delivering
Familiar with → I’m not familiar with that coding language.
family oriented (familiar) → I’m a very family oriented person.
Be used to (estar acostumbrado)
Example: I’m used to waking up early

Title: Get used to (el proceso de acostumbrarse)
Example: (tendré que acostumbrarme a levantarme temprano) - I’ll have to get used to waking up early

Title: Figure out (solve or understand)
Example: I need to figure out this problem.

Title: Find out (discover information)
Example: Let me find out when the meeting is.

Title: Point out (indicate or mention)
Example: He pointed out a mistake in the report.

Title: Carry out (perform or execute)
Example: We need to carry out the plan.

Title: End up (eventually do or become)
Example: We ended up choosing the first option.

Title: Look into (investigate)
Example: I'll look into that issue for you.

Title: Catch up (get to the same point)
Example: Let's have coffee to catch up. OR "I need to catch up on my emails."

Title: Get back to (someone) (return contact)
Example: I'll get back to you with an answer tomorrow.
